channel.title: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?
channel.description: So i've booked a one week driving course in a few months after my exams, and looking forward to it. anyone have any experience of these things? Are they worth the price and did you pass first time?

item.title: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?
item.dc:creator: @A_Legend A Legend
item.description:
@A_Legend wrote:

Allot of my friends have taking something such as that, I think they called it a “Crash course” if I’m correct?
Yes, All of them indeed have passed and in that course there is a very high pass rate encouraging allot more people to start taking it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

About 3 months after you have license you wont give a shit how many lessons you or anyone else passed after.

CHILDISH…

item.source: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?

item.title: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

I see, well I did have prior experience… My dad taught me to drive before I got my learners permit.

Australia didn’t have any real requirements other than having a learners permit for 6 months, and passing a driving test. Now it’s all been changed to what lothy said.

I do have to do a defensive driving course eventually, because I’m going to be a cop after I get out of the military. I didn’t think they were that expensive though

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?

item.title: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

45 is what the DVLA says, but they are the government etc.

I can’t see anyone in the UK having 2 with no prior driving experience, since you have to learn the maneuvers. Which are easy, but require knowledge of the test route and local area.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?

item.title: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:7, topic:266849”]The crash courses are more expensive, I’d recommend just doing lessons if you have the time.

If you’re a natural you can pass between 10-20 lessons. I think I had about 25, the average is supposedly 35 but the DVLA recommends 45 (cunts). 1 hour lessons[/quote]
45??

I had 2 lessons, at the end of the first the guy told me I would have no issues passing. The second lesson was because I had to get a ride home from my dad’s and a cab was about the same price.

Read full topic

item.source: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?

item.title: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I did the one-week crash course for my bike test (not car). Passed first time, and it was good fun getting to ride around on someone elses bike & petrol all week, but I must admit I was fuckin’ knackered by the time it came to actually doing my test. And bear in mind I could already ride a bike beforehand, tho we had people in my group that didn’t have much bike experience and they seemed ok

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?

item.title: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I don’t know about British requirements for licence upgrades, but in Australia you have to drive a minimum number of hours.
At the moment it’s 120 hours, comprised of 10 - 20 hours night driving IIRC.
Apparently they’re raising that to 200+ hours in the not too distant future.

If you’re looking to move to Australia then do yourself a favour: get your licence in the country you currently reside in and then make the move so you avoid the ridiculous burden placed on both yourself and your supervising driver.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?

item.title: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

The crash courses are more expensive, I’d recommend just doing lessons if you have the time.

If you’re a natural you can pass between 10-20 lessons. I think I had about 25, the average is supposedly 35 but the DVLA recommends 45 (cunts). 1 hour lessons

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?

item.title: Anyone do a one week intense driving course?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

depends what you want. You can do two week courses which range from about £1200 - 1500, or the one week courses which you can find for about £700 if your lucky. Mine cost me £850, but got some help from my dad

Read full topic
